Posted by  Palestinian Feminist Collective 2,451 Views 2,451 Views Palestinian Feminist Collective  was live. April 10 Why is Palestine a Feminist Issue? A conversation with members of the Palestinian Feminist Collective:  Dr. Nada Elia, a Diaspora Palestinian from Jerusalem, she ...  writes about Palestinian and transnational feminisms, gendered state violence, and organizing for social and political liberation. Nada is a former member of the organizing collective of INCITE! Women and Trans People of Color against Violence, as well as of the Steering Collective of AWSA (Arab Women's Solidarity Association).  Dr. Hana Masri, a steering member of the Palestinian Feminist Collective and a feminist scholar of communication and rhetoric.  Yazan Za3za3, a steering member of PFC and a longtime organizer with the Palestinian Youth Movement. Yazan is also the current Community Organizer at Vigilant Love, a healing justice organization committed to challenging the structural and communal impacts of Islamophobia and the War on Terror at large. Yazan holds an MA in Women's and Gender Studies from San Diego State University. Their own research focuses on the relationship between war, migration, surveillance, and social welfare programming.  The conversation was facilitated by Mira Nabulsi, a researcher and audio producer based in the San Francisco Bay Area.   See More See All See More
